title: ASUS’ New Wireless Keyboard Might Be a Great Addition to Your Desktop Setup
description: It can easily switch between different operating systems during use. The post ASUS’ New Wireless Keyboard Might Be a Great Addition to Your Desktop Setup appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: It can easily switch between different operating systems during use.
text: If you’re shopping around for a new wireless keyboard, then you might want to check out what ASUS is offering with its new Marshmallow Keyboard KW100 – now available in two new colors, the KW100 also features compatibility for different operating systems, as well as a dedicated Copilot key that instantly connects you to Microsoft’s AI assistant app. ASUS has designed the KW100 to work with Windows and ChromeOS with easy-to-use system-switch keys, as well as compatibility with iOS, MacOS, as well as iPadOS. ASUS adds that it’s made to be durable, with 10-million-keystroke switches, scissor keys, and a design that integrates two-level adjustable kickstands. It also comes in four different colors including Iridescent White, Rose Clay, Oat Milk and Green Tea Latte options. READ: The NUC 14 Essential is ASUS’ Latest Mini PC, and it’s as Basic as it Gets As for the hardware, ASUS says that the KW100’s scissor keys provide 1.6mm of key travel, with an internal foam layer for reduced typing sounds during usage. Wireless connectivity meanwhile is handled by Bluetooth 5.0 LE support.
html:
If you’re shopping around for a new wireless keyboard, then you might want to check out what ASUS is offering with its new Marshmallow Keyboard KW100 – now available in two new colors, the KW100 also features compatibility for different operating systems, as well as a dedicated Copilot key that instantly connects you to Microsoft’s AI assistant app.

ASUS has designed the KW100 to work with Windows and ChromeOS with easy-to-use system-switch keys, as well as compatibility with iOS, MacOS, as well as iPadOS. ASUS adds that it’s made to be durable, with 10-million-keystroke switches, scissor keys, and a design that integrates two-level adjustable kickstands. It also comes in four different colors including Iridescent White, Rose Clay, Oat Milk and Green Tea Latte options.

READ: The NUC 14 Essential is ASUS’ Latest Mini PC, and it’s as Basic as it Gets

As for the hardware, ASUS says that the KW100’s scissor keys provide 1.6mm of key travel, with an internal foam layer for reduced typing sounds during usage. Wireless connectivity meanwhile is handled by Bluetooth 5.0 LE support.
